body_html: Another (probably better) option, instead of adding cartesian_range, combination_range, and combination_range_with_replacement as an op of pytorch, we can just implement meshgrid, and in the doc of meshgrid, we gives 3 examples of application of using meshgrid to implement cartesian product, combinations, and combination with replacement.
body_text: Another (probably better) option, instead of adding cartesian_range, combination_range, and combination_range_with_replacement as an op of pytorch, we can just implement meshgrid, and in the doc of meshgrid, we gives 3 examples of application of using meshgrid to implement cartesian product, combinations, and combination with replacement.
body: Another (probably better) option, instead of adding `cartesian_range`, `combination_range`, and `combination_range_with_replacement` as an op of pytorch, we can just implement `meshgrid`, and in the doc of meshgrid, we gives 3 examples of application of using meshgrid to implement cartesian product, combinations, and combination with replacement.
